Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk tuned
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: tuned bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The tuned packages contain a daemon that tunes system settings dynamically. It does so by monitoring the usage of several system components periodically. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the "tuned-adm verify" command, which verifies whether the current system settings match the requested "tuned" profile, evaluated missing sysctl settings as a failure. As a consequence, verification of the realtime profile used together with the realtime kernel could fail. Also, setting sysctl parameters that are not supported on Red Hat Enterprise Linux in a "tuned" profile created by the user could cause the verification of the custom profile to fail. A patch has been applied to address this bug. As a result, the missing unsupported sysctl values are ignored during verification, a warning is logged, and verification no longer fails. Also, the "tuned" output now contains the location of the log file with more detailed information. (BZ#1282565) The nohz_full boot parameter requires the nohz feature to be enabled, which is not the default for the real-time kernel. As a consequence, nohz_full did not work, and errors could be logged. To fix the "tuned" realtime profile, nohz_full has been removed from it. As a result, nohz_full is now not requested by "tuned" realtime profile. (BZ#1282570) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: With this update, the cpumask of unbound workqueueus is set to the list of non-isolated cores in the "tuned" realtime profiles, as Red Hat Enterprise Linux and Real Time kernels now support setting the cpumask of unbound workqueues in sysfs. (BZ#1282566) Users of tuned are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
